channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump to address affordability. And, the significance of Indiana's redistricting fight
item.description: Trump travels to Pennsylvania to discuss America's affordability. And, Indiana lawmakers to vote on a congressional map that may eliminate the state's...

item.title: Ukraine's last eastern strongholds hang on as Russia fights to take Donbas
item.description: Russia is pushing to take over all of eastern Ukraine's Donbas region, where one resident tells NPR that she feels her "life depends on how our guys a...

item.title: Are we in a recession? Maybe professional Santas can tell us
item.description: Demand for professional Santas and other seasonal workers seems to have cooled. Could that be a sign we're in a recession?

item.title: President Trump expected to address affordability at Pennsylvania rally
item.description: President Trump will hold a rally in Pennsylvania Tuesday, where he's expected to talk about his administration's efforts to address two major concern...

item.title: Black bear populations are bouncing back. Here's how these Texas towns are coping
item.description: Historically, Black bears were the biggest predator to travel the Big Bend area of Texas. But overhunting and habitat loss led to their decline.

item.title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine will not cede any territory to Russia as part of deal
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is saying Ukraine will not be ceding any territory to Russia as part of a peace plan. CBS News' Ramy Inocencio reports.

item.title: Trump traveling to tout economy wins as Americans decry high prices
item.description: President Trump is visiting Pennsylvania to tout his economic achievements as more Americans decry affordability issues. CBS News' Natalie Brand repor...

item.title: Sacked agents sue FBI, saying they were punished for taking the knee
item.description: The group say adopting a gesture used by protesters helped to defuse tensions during a 2020 demonstration.

item.title: Mace criticizes GOP leaders for "restrictive and ineffective" control of House
item.description: Rep. Nancy Mace, a South Carolina Republican, criticized House GOP leaders in an op-ed for what she called their "restrictive and ineffective" control...

item.title: Trump announces $12 billion aid package for U.S. farmers
item.description: The new financial aid package is expected to shore up the U.S. agricultural sector, which has been hurt by tariffs and a trade war with China.

item.title: ICE arrests of Afghans are on the rise in the wake of National Guard attack, immigration lawyers say
item.description: Immigration lawyers and authorities say arrests of Afghans are on the rise following the shooting of two National Guard members in Washington, D.C.

item.title: New audio of off-duty pilot trying to cut plane's engines mid-flight
item.description: Joseph Emerson pleaded guilty to a federal charge of interfering with a flight crew and pleaded no contest to state charges of endangering an aircraft...

item.title: CCTV shows suspects make off on foot with stolen artworks
item.description: Brazilian officials say thieves held up a security guard and an elderly couple before making off with the artworks on foot in São Paulo.

item.title: A Democrat takes on Trump-backed candidate for Miami mayor in a key Hispanic battleground
Trump criticises 'weak' European leaders over Ukraine and immigration
item.description: In his latest public criticism of Europe, the US president claims countries are "decaying".

item.title: French feminists outraged by Brigitte Macron's comment about activists
item.description: There has been pushback to the term used by France's first lady to describe activists who interrupted comedian Ary Abittan's show.

item.title: A coup too far: Why Benin's rebel soldiers failed where others in the region succeeded
item.description: Plotters misjudged the national mood and Benin's neighbours learnt from past errors, says analyst Paul Melly.

item.title: Trump’s attacks on Minnesota’s Somali community cast a spotlight on fraud cases
